Pork Shank Appetizer - perfectly cooked, lightly sweet, soooo good!  Service - always great  -'s Prices - I think the prices are high but at least the food is consistently good

pKWydM5lt9q2KYB2s8WRKg.text: No complementary chips or salsa, waiter was overly friendly and made us all uncomfortable, and the food was ok. Go to your local, hole in the wall Mexican place -- this place is for the birds

V4ip0XLjzYraIh64hWpZlw.text: We have been fans for a long time, especially at the old location.  However, last night and the last couple of visits have been extremely disappointing.  We are salad lovers, and the 1511 salad has always been our favorite, but not since the relocation.  Salad was bland and served with three slices of chicken (as ordered) but the chicken was overcooked and under seasoned.  Margarita seemed watered down.  The kids menu for our grandchildren was much better than our dinner.  I really hope they can bring this restaurant back to the wonderful restaurant it was before on East Blvd.  I miss it.  The chips and salsa are very good.  Service is very good, but the food, not so much!

W_OQ9I3MkZNnwiU5YAmZ3Q.text: Cantina ranks up there in the places I like to visit along East Blvd.  While the businesses across the street tend to change out time and time again, Cantina seems to have weathered pretty well and has become a "go-to" staple for me whenever I am craving some good eats.  Recently visited on a Saturday for lunch and the crowd wasn't too bad.  They had streamlined there menu some and had a nice lunch menu to choose from.  I ended up having the Ancho Chicken Scaloppini & Cheese (Ancho chicken, caramelized poblano peppers and onions, melted Mexican cheeses) with a side chopped salad.  Dressing on the side, I only used about half of what they gave me but the salad was like crack and I could not get enough.  There were fresh avacados, chickpeas, jicama, greens, corn, black beans, and a whole lot of goodness packed into a small plate of salad.  The chicken on the sandwich was packed full of flavor.  My one comment was that some of the liquid from the chicken made the bread a bit soggy, but I powered through anyway.  The cheeses all melted in your mouth and I was stuffed in a good way for lunch that day.  I know this place is pretty popular in the evenings, but the one thing that I do get annoyed with is the parking situation.  It's great if you live down the street and can walk, but unfortunately the parking lot - they have done the best with what they have, but I do feel awkward parking in front of employees cars (double parking) but I think they do valet too so they can put your car wherever.  The patio is pretty amazing when the weather is cooperating.  And no visit to Cantina 1511 is complete without some tableside guacamole.

ORRaCblwcRk7LmaTdS-9-w.text: I called this restaurant today to place an order, their effin representative hung up on me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

0CsKmRhcHh1gExUSyjC-xw.text: Oh how I wish I could have given this very popular place more stars. I don't know, maybe because I grew up in a Mexican neighborhood in Chicago, or that I lived on the West Coast for years, but I have a certain expectation for Mexican food that I have really yet to find here in Charlotte (except at a couple of dive joints down South Blvd). Anyway, I know the whole story about the South African owner, and JWU trained Chefs, blah blah blah. But here's the story....the food just isn't that spectacular. It isn't. The guacamole was good, but had TOO much line and not enough salt to bring out the flavors. It could have used more red onion as well. The chips were good, but lacked salt and didn't seem that fresh to me. The Orange and Spice Crusted Pork Tenderloin was average, and the pork was well done, not a pink center which I asked for. The "crust" part was tough to chew, and I just couldn't finish the dish because of it.   I got their "spicy" Margarita and while good, I didn't get the whole "spicy" flavor that our lovely Community Manager Nikki raved about. I'm thinking, WHERE'S THE HEAT? It did say SPICY didn't it??? Ugggg  The highlight of the evening was them giving us the Queso and tortilla as a complimentary extra. Now THAT was really good....honestly the only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 2.  The restaurant is really loud, and very busy. Which is a good sign. But I'm convinced that the good folks of Charlotte just haven't had a really GREAT, AUTHENTIC Mexican restaurant yet. When you do, you'll see just how different and BETTER it is than all these Tex/Cali Mex places that exist in Charlotte.  Look, this is a decent place for sure. Will I come back? Probably, and just get a darn Burrito, Chimi, Quesaidilla or Fajita. Maybe they do those the best?

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Margarita
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresly made Guacamole
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso!

4GaHkm8WcXhCAYNV6ga7rQ.text: My biggest disappointment were the pre-made drinks that tasted like adult juice. Ordered two tacos, al pastor and another I can't remember, both were underwhelming. I've been here before and also not been thrilled. Although the staff is always very friendly. If you're shopping in the area or going to see a movie, it's not terrible, but not anything special.

S38DqCDeKFpb1Hoz4iuiZw.text: As reported by other Yelpers The food at this place is at best subpar. While I cannot comment on the Mexican food the hamburger I ordered was absolutely tasteless.. I was left wondering if it was made of beef or some other matter. I should have paid attention to the other reviews and steered clear of this place.

8nLb7rdeNt19jLXazt6aJA.text: Mex restaurant so why Cuban music the entire time? Only good food was the chips and salsa and chicken tingas, carne asada sucked. Service slow and horrible.

k0WNhdVltPL_ObbYfd7ByQ.text: My first trip to the new location. Despite the parking issues I really prefer the old location.  This new one is an open space and LOUD!!!! You have to yell across the table to converse. This is the concept that many places use to attract the younger crowd although we boomers are a much larger market.    We had reservations but had to wait for a table. After making an ass of myself about this I was informed that a reservation only moves you to the head of the wait list when you show up. This used to be called "call ahead" whereas a reservation should hold you a table. It was a good thing we got there early on a Wednesday evening because at 730 when we left the line was out the door.     Thankfully our waitstaff was excellent as was the food!  chicken chimi for me and crab quesadilla for my bride.

yBUWMegt0pBR287A5eyfQg.text: Had the Pina Margarita and Mexican BBQ Pork. Both were delicious and I had so much food.. I couldn't even finish all of my pork, but I definitely tried it was so good. Our waiter was super friendly, overall a great experience!

kefjCPgiP-dq66b4n21jmw.text: I can't say enough good things about Cantina 1511.. However, one thing about me is that I kept ordering the same darn thing when I go there or many other places at that. I'm In love with the mojitos. I have tried every types they offer. Having their mojitos on my birthday was the perfect way to keep my mid life crisis at bay.  I alway ordered the fish tacos every time. Nothing to complain about. I did recently visited them and order their "street" food platter. Which includes battered calamari, meatball with cheese, nacho salad, some other type of food I can't remember. This is the perfect way for me to step outside my box. I'm always a big fan of tapas. And it's exactly that. Everything on that platter is delicious. I would order it again. Customer services is alway great, the way I remember it. But most of the time, I'm tipsy from their mojitos by the time I leave. Haha. Either way, I have visited them many times before and will continue to do so as long as they don't change too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Street food platter
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZDEeRZH-a-S_4oFaG5fLvw.text: Cantina 1511 is a nice family restaurant with a good variety of Tex-Mex options.  Their servers are always very nice and you always get seated immediately especially given the high demand in the Park Rd shopping center.  I highly recommend their guacamole as it is very fresh and they make the cut open the avocado and make it right in front of you.  For the most part, their food is very good and very fresh.  My recommended option for the Tex-Mex genre.

ylnHfPT33RuCORou2C4u4g.text: This was our friends favorite place in Charlotte so I was excited to give it a run. Great little spot, I liked the look and feel. I went with the Chimichanga because I read a review where it "sent her to the heavens" ha. Loved that. I may not have been raptured but it was good. They have a great queso and salsa, no complaints. I'm not particularly a cilantro salsa fan but it wasn't too much and didn't distract from the fresh taste. Service was on point. Would have loved to enjoy their nice patio but it was a little chilly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cool ambiance
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wish it was warmer
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Five Cheese Queso Fundido

nlKN38b5Zf5rpNL0InW1bA.text: Cantina is one of my favorite more upscale Mexican restaurants.  They have a nice size outdoor patio and lots of indoor seating.  They also take reservations .  If you want to watch a sporting event there are tons of tvs at the bar area.  Cantina does a really good job with big groups as well.  We went here for dinner and drinks to watch the PGA. (Big deal its Charlottes first one!!! )  For an appetizer I recommend the queso or quac.  They are both reallly tasty!    I have have the Marco Pollo tacos (ahhhmazing), chopped salad, fajitas, and chicken quesadilla (the one with bacon ). Everything is always really good.  The service can be hit or mess and I think that's why Cantina doesn't have 4 stars on Yelp.  Tonight I had to ask for my queso, more chips, and water refills (clearly I was starving and thirsty ), but the food was cooked perfectly!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese dip
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken quesadilla
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

q3blg9syMvcmzz56kK779A.text: The Papa Grande still rains supreme at Cantina 1511! After a long week, you can never go wrong with a good strong margarita.   Cantina has been a favorite for some time. However, I must admit that the move to Park Rd from East Blvd has left much to be desired. The previous location had a certain vibe during the warmer months. Open patio, Papa Grandes flowing, guac mixed to perfection...#issavibe. The new location seems congested, loud, and a bit too fast-casual. Not a location I would pick with better atmospheres available in the city.   FOOD Guacamole mixed at the table to spicy preference was good. Better towards the end, so ask your server to mix well. Chips always salted to perfection (little things make a big difference).   I ordered the Thai Chili Shrimp tacos with corn tortillas. They were good...nothing to rave about.   Our food came quickly and correctly, no complaints.

YeY6k-liPcDNlGbqa70miQ.text: Went to eat and by our calculations, our server had 4 tables.  We ran out of chips, drinks and salsa.  At one point we ordered Guacamole and waited 5 minutes for chips to arrive.  At one point our table was so full of empty bottles and drinks that we had to put them on another table.    Our meal was not complicated but took too long to come out.  So much so that our dish was luke warm.  I have been to this place before and had good service but I will NEVER go again on a Saturday night.

MWwv1kwnM-ikPsGDvySang.text: Here's the thing...I'm always up for Mexican.   It doesn't matter how many times I've had it for the week, if someone asks me if I want tacos....the answer is always yes.   Cantina 1511 just doesn't do it for me. I've been to this location a few different times for dinner and I've never been impressed. This last visit was no different. The service was a bit off, our waiter was new and didn't really know the menu and seemed to try a bit to hard (he hovered) after we got our food so it was warm at best when we started eating.    As for the food, I've had the tacos, quesadillas and on my most recent visit the chimichanga. Nothing here makes me say "I'd like to have that again". I think that's why I've tried so many different options to see if I could find one thing that really blows me away. The chips and salsa were "meh", if you like spicy I do recommend the jalapeno version.   Either way, this place isn't my thing. Also, "Taco Tuesday" here is kid's night. So keep that in mind when you make your plans. You're welcome.

Bb07clJkfCgY7hdH9x_sSg.text: We ate at Cantina's former location on East Blvd several times, but hadn't ventured to their new Park Road location since they moved.  We go to Flying Biscuit across the shopping center frequently for breakfast, but Cantina 1511 doesn't open for brunch before 11, so we never arrived late enough to give them a try.  Lucky for us, they offered Easter Brunch one hour earlier, so we were able to finally try their breakfast.  I have to say, I like this location better than East Blvd.  It's roomier and brighter, with tables a bit further spaced apart than the smaller previous location.  They play awesome rock music, too.  The Easter menu was the usual brunch menu.  My husband and I both had the huevos rancheros - mine with scrambled eggs (with cheddar), and his with fried eggs.  I can't begin to describe how good this dish was.  Unlike other places, Cantina serves their huevos rancheros over two cheese quesadillas.  There are black beans underneath the quesadillas, which are then topped with eggs, salsa, Mexican crema, and cotija cheese.  Both of our eggs were cooked perfectly, too.  Their chips and salsa are also phenomenal.  (Yes, we ate a full basket while waiting for our eggs!)  Their chips are really thin and light, and their salsa is fresh, with finely chopped tomatoes and fresh cilantro.  It's medium spicy, in case you were wondering.  It's so good!  Their coffee is also delicious.  It's very strong, and has great flavor.  Service is friendly and efficient here as well.    We'll definitely be back.  I only wish they'd offer earlier brunch all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huevos rancheros with scrambled eggs
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huevos rancheros with fried eggs

qKfdViItP0XdHgAGRlfj5A.text: There was a 45 minute wait time on a Friday evening, but we got our table as promised. The menu was an interesting mix of authentic Mexican food and Mexican burgers. We went for the usuals, tacos, Fajitas and the burger. Our waitress was extremely friendly and provided us a great hospitality. There are hardly few waitresses who would care for your well being, she was one of them. Forgot to get her name. The chips and salsa were not the best but medium sized and okay. The food came in without much delay. I got the El Diablo burger and it was a killer! Double patty and super spicy! I tried but couldn't complete the whole burger in one sitting. Overall we had a good experience. And for an upscale restaurant that looked really fashionable it wasn't that expensive. 30 to 40$ for food and drinks for two! Great deal I would say. If you wouldn't mind the wait time, I say check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. El Diablo burger - incredibly spicy!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hard shell tacos

HqvJYRmj4ImXr0aLLZRObQ.text: Great margaritas, excellent fajitas and tacos, great service.   This is a fun place! The margaritas are all very good - spicy pepper 1800 was a good call by the waiter.

JEwt_mvrCuOl-UVmEE-tgg.text: Food was great, our server Jason was even better. 10/10 would recommend.   Margarita Quesadilla  Cuatro Leche

Smn3C5wJZvH9A3o8Y_dMaQ.text: Review update!!  Still a great place to come. I had the grilled fish tacos and the Al Pastor.  I have been dreaming about the fish tacos since last visit.  I was VERY disappointed in it this time!  The fish was fishy, cold, and the mango sauce or salsa that comes on top was literally like a cold jelly or ice cream topping. It was smooth with the consistency of ketchup and seemed like it was opened from a packet.  Yuck!!!  I will never order again.  The Al Pastor stayed True and was delicious.  Great flavor.  The side salad was also delicious.  The dressing comes mixed in and the amount is perfect.   Good service and chips & salsa were divine.  Love the atmosphere!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso Dip=delicious!!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

gvJyH24mC6UKCOdv-hvr6g.text: If you follow my post, you know I am always down for a margarita. lol.  don't judge me lol. anyway it's taco Tuesday, this is the closest place to my job so a coworker and I decide to go here. There aren't any taco specials on the menu for Tuesday and only 2 drink special. It is also kids eat free on Tuesday...really on taco Tuesday, why not do Thursday? Food was good,  I like the 3 different options for salsa. I ordered the al pastor taco and the other pork taco. I could only find one after loading up on chips, salsa and guac.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. one of each pork taco

2wmy7sL1Dfs3ZQCxKt9MOQ.text: Unfortunately since Cantina has moved from East Blvd to Park Road Shopping Center it has not been the same. I have visited multiple times since the relocation and haven't updated my review because I wanted to give them a chance but unfortunately I cannot say that it has. This most recent visit prompted me to update my review. I arrived on a Wednesday evening with no wait, great. Chips and salsa were delivered and we ordered a few margarita's. I chose the house, the Casa Margarita, and was told it was premixed. Well, let me tell you, horrible! It is so sweet that I actually sent it back. Decided to go ahead and order a Corona, arrived with no lime, really??? As for the food, I ordered two tacos, chicken and pork, both great. But unfortunately I ordered rice and beans and the rice was so bad I cannot even explain it. And, the fact that they placed the beans in top of the rice, which should never be done, did they know the rice was bad...trying to cover it up? Wrong!!! Overall, there are too many Mexican restaurants that this is not on my go to.

Hb6hC5XjVNiUWChUItuYdg.text: Great meal (as always!) This place is a constant....great food and great service. Daniel was an extremely friendly server. Fantastic list of top shelf margaritas

23mdFrDIhRztk4lQCJ7IrQ.text: A colleague of mine is getting ready to retire, and she did not want a lot of fuss for her retirement party. She's also a tequila lover, so what better way to send her off than to have a fiesta!  Event planning at Cantina 1511 is pretty seamless. All of their options are posted online, and they offer invoice billing and tax exempt, which is so helpful when you work in the nonprofit sector. They even offer gluten free options as part of their event menus!  We used the private room in the back of the restaurant, which was free to use for a lunch event. It is well sectioned off and is truly private, but it is not a separate room so you do hear noise from the restaurant crowd. No biggie to our group!   The food and service were terrific. We had a set menu with four entree options as well as salsa, chips, and guacamole for starters. The guacamole is clearly freshly made in house. It was delicious! I split an enchilada with chicken and spinach as well as tacos carne de asada with a coworker, and both were equally good. I also appreciated that our server did not rush us and kept pace with our group as needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Private room space

eEOQMB1EEhR_nEayszmN1w.text: Sooooooo... I ate here today and the food was NOT QUALITY. It was one of those restaurants where when I left, I was actually upset that I paid money for that bland, unseasoned, mediocre burrito bowl. I asked for salt for the "burrito bowl" I was eating and it still wasn't enough to bring some life to the taste of disappointment that ran across my tongue with each bite. I honestly think there is more spice in a doughnut from Suarez bakery across the street. People rant and rave about how good this place is and simply put... it's just NOT all that at all.   2 stars because the food did come out fast, but this is a situation where I wish it hadn't come out at all.

DGk0V58YYnG7qT5S7K29wA.text: Very disappointing for a more upscale Mexican restaurant.  It's located in park road shopping center.  There is plenty of parking available.  Chips and salsa were tasty however, the queso dip was a disappointment.  How do you mess up melted cheese.  There was absolutely nothing great about the food.  It was so disappointing I can't even remember which kind of tacos I ordered.  The rice was inedible.    It is a large restaurant with plenty of outdoor seating on the front patio.  A great view of the parking lot ;)   I will not be returning to this restaurant.  There's tons of Mexican restaurants to choose from in Charlotte and this one does not make the cut.

j-bdkn_HnkYTq-Ys8LwlZg.text: Might as well go to chili's for the quality of Mexican food you get here. Would not recommend.

JtUVS-Iavvqn_IjPnjlduQ.text: Me and my grandson chose Cantina 1511(park rd)for our after church lunch. I ordered the chimichunga and was wonderful. Our server was Daniel who was very thorough with menu choices , filling our drinks, and offering chips salsa and desert samples. Great job Daniel!

il3GzOsxi2HtllyOLE0l2w.text: Now this is a place that knows what they're doing! Friend got the crab quesadilla and I got the chicken enchiladas. Both were so flavorful and amazing. Great margaritas with a wide variety of flavors and options. Order the quest and it comes with a tiny candle underneath to keep it warm. Genius! We also ordered the guacamole and our waiter made it tableside right in front of us. Nice, filling portions for the price as well. Will definitely be back.

G3b3O3Vo3Z3NTaaLtw6s5A.text: We had a reservation at 7:30 for a party of 12 for a birthday party. We arrived at 7:20 and were told our tables were almost ready, that a previous party was finishing up at our table. Not a problem. 815 we were still waiting and the manager said she had an idea, she could place a table at the end of the booth, but it was going to be too cramped, then she suggested 2 booths, splitting up the party, which defeated the point of being all together for a birthday party. The manager was nice but the hostesses were very rude and snotty behind our backs as we waited to see if our original reserved tables were ready. We heard the hostesses bad mouthing our entire party, mainly the birthday girl, and were very upset with how they were talking about us with us right there. We addressed the situation to the same manager who was helping us and she apologized and said everyone was on edge because the owner was in that night. Really? I'd hate to see service on a night he wasn't there! About 830 we finally sat down at 2 different booths against what we wanted, but it was late and we were all hungry. You would think that with the problems this far service would be top notch, WRONG! We waited another 10-15 mins before our waitress even came to see what we wanted to drink, then took forever to receive waters, and a bucket of beer. We were right next to the bar, we would have had faster service walking up to the bar individually. We were promised free guacamole for our troubles with the RSVP but that too seemed like it would never come out. Our other table had a little better service then we did from another waiter. Our other table received their food before ours was even ordered, we finally got our food around 915-930, few orders wrong and the birthday girls food was nowhere to be found. Another manager walked by and we had had it at this point. We addressed the food and drink issues and how long we had been there, drinks and correct food came out very quickly after that. But before that our waitress came over and yelled at one in our party who's food came out wrong. She said it was his fault and she asked him 4 different times what he wanted, well why in the hell did it come out wrong then?! The nerve of her to yell at a customer! The original manager came over towards the end of dinner and told the birthday girl she hoped her night got better, laughed at us and walked away. Rudest service hands down. We did get some of our bill comped, but by then it didn't matter, food was cold, served wrong or not served at all, and all by the rudest wait staff in Charlotte. We will never attend Cantina again and plan on making a complaint with the owner and telling all of our experience.

HYP0q2q9A9gjt5Hw59E0rQ.text: As close as you can get to high end Mexican( is there such a thing?) in this town. Great location, good service, ample parking & a braised pork taco to die for! The waiters will make fresh guacamole right in front of you! One of the places I take out of town family & friends.

_ETM5W5nQQW3sISpH9R2Fw.text: I absolutely love this resturant. I have never had a bad experience. The wait staff is quick and the food is fabulous!

bNTiK_Bhfawl6K2JGNnuhg.text: This was trip four, and time to sing the Cantina's praises. They're consistently sparkling - the smells as you enter, the grown up staff, the array of menu choices with both traditional Mexican cuisine and Tex-Mex, the unique salsa, the wonderful and varying flavors and presentations all add up to what you've been hoping to find in a fine Mexican restaurant, and just did. The Salmon al Pastor delighted from the grilled pineapple cap through the perfectly not-overcooked salmon tp the delightful pico de gallo. I was allowed a small taste of the Carones Mojo y Ajo; again, the flavors were fresh and original and not at all stereotypical. Sorry - no room for dessert.

ug-UmLPTSO8e9mq_H6rzOg.text: Excellent, the flavors were fantastic.  I got the chicken milanese, which i would get again next time I am here.  There is little parking, they had valet when we went.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab and avacado quesadillas $12 great!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken milanese $13...excellent!

KPLsOwr7c0nUf6zo1A4ggA.text: Love this place! The queso is pure cheesy deliciousness, the barbacoa pork is incredibly juicy, and the sweet tea is a definite 10! Bejng from the west coast I was dying to try some Carolina BBQ and definitely have nothing but positive things to say about this place. The decor is also charming and service great.

lAMdEd5tpMVHsr1yl461Mw.text: This place is so good!  It's delicious, the drinks are great and the staff is very kind.  Love the brisket quesadilla. Go! And ask for Jamal

vYt23xZClnfYcwYCgycjyw.text: Visiting Charlotte & found this place on Yelp.  Food was awesome and would definitely go back.  Guacamole rocks!

WRmFMS4SGi0fCYbITx5Rbg.text: Great enchiladas and awesome dessert selection! I have a sweet tooth and it's always satisfied by the nutella pie! I like both locations one of my favorites!

XOhzZdrPRXrwbcNpzA6H6g.text: Another Mexican place that makes Americanized Mexican food that reliance a on lots of cheese and salsa.  Nearly everything looks and tastes the same.  If you want American Mexican, flowing chips and salsa and sweet margaritas, there is always a crowd.

V2DhgpNZA-sv9zhnNvPhag.text: Not so much tex-mex as it is authentic regional Mexican cuisine, Cantina is a welcome treat in Charlotte.  Coming from California where traditional Mexican is common and delicious, I was a little disappointed in Mexican fare here - until I found Cantina 1511.  I'll definitely be back!

xpXeF4EHcMW6PNZUcKn1qw.text: A little pricey but delicious!! We started off with the Street Food Platter ... so delish that right there is a meal in its self! Apparently the selections vary but I believe on that day we had the biggest calamari I have seen in my life, quesadillas, and some kind of meatballs which were pretty tasty. I had the Pan Seared Sea Scallops and Shrimp as my main course and it was delish ... but very salty. I love salt nom nom nom... but those scallops were like pretty much soaked in a vat of salt and then thrown into the pan . The shrimp was delish but the scallops thumbs down . My sister had the chicken tacos and she thought they were pretty tasty as well. We told the waiter it was my sisters birthday and he brought out a piece of a piece of the four milk cake ... obviously they didn't include chocolate milk in this cake so I didn't eat any, but my sister did she said it was alright. She may have enjoyed it more if we weren't so full off of the appetizer, margaritas and main course! Overall I really liked this place and would love to try it again!

tbjZCSzN7y3PaptKwrLqrA.text: Food was good. We both got the 2 taco plates. Salsa is awesome! We go here on/off - always a good experience.

j7JiUFKekg-QtWuqQBg4Tw.text: Amazing! Get the Pollo Laredo -I get it every time and everyone at the table always wishes they went for it! Excellent restaurant!

U7GTz8mm-PfQg3rR0FOdRw.text: This was the saltiest food I've ever had.  The location was trendy but couldn't save it from the horrible food.  This is a must-miss.  Taco Bell is more authentic.

cBhZWbKkxD3p2aQP5hcKkw.text: I have been coming to cantina for a while. But I feel like it's starting to change somehow. When we arrived we realized that we were going to have to valet because parking is slim, which is normal. The valet was very friendly and organized. We were seated quickly upon entering the restaurant. Our waiter was very nice even though it took him a bit to get our drinks. I ordered a steak burrito and not only was it a ton of food but it was also excellent. It took a while for our waiter to bring our bill, which is understandable because they were busy. All in all I feel like cantina is still very good. But since the change of ownership things seem a little different. I hate to make the comparison but Cantina is starting to feel like a tgi Fridays for me, instead of a local restaurant.

k1eJFnqUjqomumvcJjJEew.text: of all frank scibelli's culinary magnets in charlotte, this is my favorite.  cantina 1511 is a really fun place to eat.  an extensive drink menu, colorful decor, and an eye-catching wall mural of "gone with the wind" in spanish all make for an eclectic mix of quirky and predictable.  the food is reliably good, and it's not your average mexicamerican masquerading as latin american cuisine.  the utilization of atypical spices, sauces, pickles, and other unusual accoutrements showcase the chef's savvy.  this is definitely not your middling shredded meat, rice, and beans dinner.  the "top shelf" guacamole is great, and i'm a fool for the tacos.  i usually mix and match them to my heart's content.  the milanese and the roasted chicken tacos are especially cross-eyed inducing.  i eat here relatively frequently, and i've had the occasional bummer server, but they are few-and-far-between.  if there ever is a problem, i notice that the manager takes care of it quite quickly.  on a sour note, i brought a vegan friend here, and chicken mysteriously wound up in her meal after we sent it back to the kitchen on three separate occasions.  the manager was very apologetic, but i was extremely frustrated to see such a simple error occur multiple times in succession.  parking sucks here on the weekend, but if you can get over having to look for a spot or fork over the money for valet, you're definitely in for a night of good fun and wonderful food.  if you're not disgustingly full after dinner, please try the desserts.  the chef's variation of tres leches is delicious and very shareable.  hat's off for the umpteenth time, maestro scibelli.

P9yOmw-YTAOyeo48tbBlQg.text: Hands down the best Mexican food in Charlotte.  Service was great everything.  Try the Guacamole it is to die for. You may want to make a reservation this place packs in the people..

j-sTcB1dJdDR29kkXTzy4w.text: Good but not great.  I like the tacos, specifically the pastor and asada on white corn.  And the queso and guac are great.  I can't find anything else on the menu that is particularly good after so many visits.  I've tried the new things they have added but they just taste cheesy, not authentic.  I know they can do better...

SZURINJasDN3WLtbdQ8RrA.text: Dinner last night with 10 people.  The food was good even though they screwed the order up.  A little bit pricey but the serving was generous.  The chips and salsa were great.  The atmosphere was laid back.  I'll go back.

2o3z_1el_OYzmKLHy5q58g.text: Food: mediocre. I had a hard time deciding because everything sounded good, but no one at my table was really that satisfied. Service: awful. Rude and distracted, they messed up orders and forgot to refill drinks. Atmosphere was okay. Expected way better.

3QJ3RQaQLR3UklMv4L2Oqw.text: This place is great. my husband and i ate at cantina for date night and it was amazing. He has never been a fan of mexican food but he was blown away not only by the options, but also that the carne azteca steak dish was better than his favorite texas roadhouse steak fries and ribs!  From the attentive staff ( not only the service..management and host as well!), to the creative decorations we had the best time we have had in a long time. You can definitely tell that this place takes much pride in all that they do. Will most definitely be back.

KDxmKXlDimAdx5YPRqyGNA.text: Happy hour: Amazing, Cheap, and Drinks! I came here for a happy hour with a friend of mine (which was really a failed party, which became like a default date...) The appetizers were filling, and the drinks weren't too bad on the price. I think that there should have been a little bit more space, except I wasn't too worried about it because it was just the two of us.  Overall, I would come here for happy hour itself. South Charlotte isn't quite my scene so I don't think I would get to try out the other dinner options. We'll see if that changes though.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cantina nachos

QxjsQ4BvGQlzpyGYpMp6tA.text: I've been here on two separate occasions and I can say that I'm pleased with the food for the most part the service is blah just because they are usually pretty busy but the food is great I love the pork tacos they're street corn is great.

dY8UBTwInb8YRFbhSUo9Yg.text: Cantina 1511 has been a staple restaurant for my wife and I since moving to Charlotte 6 years ago.  It was recommended to us when we first moved here, and we have since recommended it to others.  The food and service are always excellent.  I love getting 2 Marco Polo tacos with their delicious side salad.  Another favorite is the Carnitas (Mexican barbequed pork).  Obviously, with so many positive reviews, you know their doing things right.

U3EUSqJQxyRzuXYVClKIqQ.text: This is the first Mexican restaurant I have been to in Charlotte that was run by Americans and more upscale than most Mexican restaurants. I'll start off by saying the food was delicious! I was impressed with the food and waiter, but not the wait time and cooks.   I ordered a beef chimichanga without beans. After waiting about 40 minutes or longer on our order, our food arrived. I cut into my chimichanga and saw mostly black beans and also realized that the bean juice (whatever you want to call it) was drizzled over it as well. I sent it back, and maybe 4 minutes later received the next one. I did specify after the first one, not to put the bean juice on the second one. When you order something without beans you would think the chef would realized you don't want bean juice on the food either.  At first glance it looked correct, but once I cut into it I saw that it was a chicken chimichanga, NOT beef without beans as I ordered. The waiter never asked if it came out correctly, and fortunately I love chicken so I ate it and didn't complain. I was glad in the long run that it was chicken because it tasted so good. The salsa inside was so fresh and delicious, how could I say anything.   I would go back, but not without a coupon. This is the most expensive Mexican restaurant I have ever been to ($14.75 for mine). The other disappointment was the booth. The seats were so low that is was uncomfortable.   There is patio seating outside, but right beside the street. I don't know if you could hear the cars driving by, but I assume you can. We were there on a weekend evening, and we could see a guy strumming his guitar and singing. The people on the patio seemed to enjoy his company.   My overall experience was frustrating, but the food was really good. I don't think I would go back, just because they seemed to busy to care about the customers.

pggfpbRg8vygeJbx8o5_WA.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere and always good food and great service! I love the new location! The acoustics make it a little hard to have a conversation on busy nights, but it is ok because the food is so good, you are eating and not talking!  The cheerful and helpful staff is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Danielle!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ray and Jessica enjoying dinner!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

zKZmU_PKHkwkhJGt-WIgyA.text: Brian greeted us like family and Stephen was an awesome mind reader. He got an extra tip because I could not make up my mind. Perfect food for a rough Monday!

iDGwD9s-EYszIFNzB90H8Q.text: This use to be a fantastic place! I loved it, however with my most resent visit I can tell that something has changed and it wasn't good. The menus were different as well as the friendliness of the staff and the quality of the food. We waited for 45 minutes and my fries were ice cold and my black bean burger was extremely bland. It's so not what it use to be and that's so unfortunate. I won't be returning there are way better Mexican restaurants in the area.

7cqI5ANxgLXa5lteadznYQ.text: A great place to enjoy authentic Tex mex food   Take it from me, you will like this place. Nachos and fajitas are amazing

tRjH5w9tpnkmOfiW_7HM7A.text: My friends and I came for our first visit because our friend recommended it. Not sure why she recommended it. The food was sub par and the prices were too high for the quality. I would have I preferred eating at Los Arcos or even Taco Bell for that matter. The guacamole was okay. Would have given one star, but our server, Hannah, made our experience much more enjoyable even though none of us enjoyed our dishes. She was very accommodating and anticipated our needs before we needed something. Hannah was funny, charming, and a great server. Unfortunately the food did not match the service.

RKLD7Xdyo2iC0G3sGfNzKQ.text: Been coming for years.  They always had the best chicken nachos.  I've frequently dropped in for them for a quick solo dinner. They've recently changed the recipe from fajita style chicken to bland and soft pulled stewed chicken.  Texture and flavor are poor. Ruined the dish. So disappointing.  Guess I won't be coming back as often.  It's a shame.  Nice people and nice atmosphere.  Many other dishes are good but not so often what I'm in the mood for as the fajitas.

UMJlfolL1Eaf6aIng0c9zg.text: One of my favorite Mexican places around town - you get a ton of food for the price, and they make the best margaritas I've ever had! Definitely a great place to go on date night or an evening out with friends. Great atmosphere, awesome friendly staff, definitely worth the coin.

7ODMhd02GzFlL2pKrIKWlA.text: Excellent, just plain excellent.  Showed up with reservations with a large group (8) on a Thursday night.  We were on a mission that night and had been sampling food all over Charlotte, and Cantina was the last stop.  We ordered the tableside Guacamole which was to die for.  Our server whipped it right up and it tasted perfect.  One thing however, we ordered 2 tableside guacamole's and they only prepared 1 tableside.  The other was just brought to us from the kitchen.  Not sure what's up with that.  The Barbacoa was a crowd favorite, I have had this at the other location and it has been on point every time.  Duck Taco's, again a work of art.  3 on a plate and they did not disappoint.  I would highly recommend any of these dishes.  Cantina is Tex Mex at it's finest.  Great location, great service, great food......roll credits.

398wU-E9kDJotuIowab1Ww.text: This is our go-to Mexican restaurant.  The menu is a great blend of traditional and unique flavors, and is consistently good.  The made-at-your table guacamole is not to be missed, and the servers are friendly and knowledgeable about helping you make the best choice to your liking.  We have tried lunch, brunch, dinner, and catering, and have always been well pleased. This is a family-friendly establishment with both indoor and outdoor seating. There is a full bar, and margaritas to please just about any taste. Try the barbacoa and just about anything that includes avocado! Cantina 1511...yes, please!

h7HfbaP5FHhoc8WY9je9Ew.text: Cantina 1511 has food ninjas. My tastebuds were unsuspecting and did not see it coming.  I think these may have been the best fajitas I've ever had. That is kind of weird. I don't have fajitas that often because they're kind of labor intensive. Also, they're not really that Mexican-y and kind of safe. Who wants to do all that construction for a stir fry taco?  I had to eat my words which was hard because I was also full from eating those scrumptious fajitas. The ingredients were fresh, starting with chicken, peppers and onions. Making a great meal with fresh ingredients is almost idiot proof. The meat and vegetable were seasoned with something different I can't quite figure, maybe a marinade?, but it wasn't the usual cumin and salt overdose. My dining companion ordered fish tacos and I'm sure I could have eaten those as well.  The restaurant has a chic ambiance and is large. However, the hardwood floors and wooden interior give it a friendly and intimate vibe. So despite the size of the dining area, it's not faceless.  Cantina 1511 isn't striving for the "authenticity" of an ordinary Mexican joint and that's a good thing. You won't find the standard numbered menu items, 1 taco, 2 enchiladas or plates swimming in enough cheese, sauce and oil to put you to sleep on the drive home. That's not a diss; I do love a spot where everyone speaks Spanish and serves it up that style. However, Cantina offers a welcome hipper and fresher take on Mexican fare.

yZhGjTs3mpv7ZppTrNif6w.text: Food was really good.   I had the Big Burrito with Chicken and it was done really well.  The only drawback was the service.  Came during lunch and it just seemed lacking.  I eat out a lot and a little bit goes along way with me.

Bqr-yYNp2amFLgw_1xMSfQ.text: I had been to Cantina 1511 once before and wasn't really impressed with that experience.  This experience was much better.    This time I sat at the bar about 1 1/2 hours before closing time.  I asked the bartender what they had in local beers - OMB's Copper on draft and Foothills Hoppyum in the bottle.  Ok.  This wasn't starting out well.  Do they know about the local craft beer craze?  Moving on, I don't remember what I had the last time I was here so I asked the bartender what she would suggest and it was a pork taco where you make your tacos with the  toppings provided on the plate.  I asked if i substitute crunchy corn shells instead of the flour tortillas and she said I could do that.  This was a wonderful recommendation.  The flavors from these tacos danced in my mouth.  Also the best place for the beans and rice were on the taco.  People who have read my reviews know I am not a big beans and rice person because they often lack in flavor but not here.   The salsa was great here as well.  Just the right amount of heat.  The chips could have been better.  It appeared they were from out of a bag because all I received were broken pieces.  But overall, this was a great experience.

t7dTvOcf7P9bzrwt0-10bw.text: Awful. Bland flavored food. One member of our party had hair in her food. GROSS!!! Service didn't come with a smile. The manager who came over to apologize was nice. I will never go back.

qulqAgsUB65euz72pawWzw.text: Not the best burgers but environment is great and I recommend to get actual Mexican food there. The burger was basically a taco on a bun, gets a little soggy but fresh chips and everything else was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. This place looks great atmosphere good midwestern feel. Only suggestion dont get the burger get real mexican food. Burgers not the best

ez1tqTwxoHWNVUZCt3-MrA.text: My wife and I come here every 3 weeks or so.  it's one of our favorite places in the area.  I haven't had a bad dish here yet, but stand out favorites are the Tortilla Soup and the french fries.  French fries at a Mexican place?  YES!  They are lightly battered and crispy but still fluffy inside.  A huge plate for $4...  enough for 2-3 people, easily.  My wife and I will make a meal of 2 large Tortilla soups and a plate of fries to share.

lCsshP_-E1-4oe1tgym_PA.text: I've honestly never really been a fan of this place. I was in the area and a gf wanted to come here for lunch. We got sat right away and our server was very sweet. They do have a lunch menu but it's a pretty limited selection.   The chips and salsa were ok. The chips were super salty and the salsa was too tangy for my taste. I decided to get the taco burrito and my friend got the black bean burger. My taco burrito was lukewarm. It was cold on the inside. I'm guessing since my friend ordered the burger and fries, they made mine first and it just sat at the window til hers was done. The rice is also not good! It's too sweet!!   Definitely not my first choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco burrito and rice
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bean burger and fries
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and salsa

6PSFsVHrIg08Rr3l_nlp1A.text: I enjoyed a nice birthday dinner celebration here. We enjoyed the pitcher of a margarita and individual entrees. I had the southwest salad which I thoroughly enjoyed and it was a huge portion. I made it about 1/4 of the way through and boxed it. I hope the table enjoyed it because I forgot it before I left. I never do that! :( I was so upset, and was looking forward to it the second time the next day. Oh well, my mistake. Then my two friends got the fish and steak tacos and the enchiladas which were very enjoyable. Lastly, was the tres leches and churros! Yummy yum!

nG3cxIoiSLTOOT4k7gAh7A.text: Cantina 1511 used to be one of my very favorite Mexican spots when we visited the Dilworth location, but this one was just mediocre for us.  The staff was awesome, helpful and cheerful.  Where they fell short was the quality of the food.  We started with cheese dip, and it had an odd flavor I couldn't identify.  They bring it out with a tealight underneath, but that did nothing for keeping ours from getting cold and clumpy.  Plus, there were onion slices in the queso, making it even more chunky.    The shrimp taco my daughter got was delicious, and she wished she had only gotten those.  The steak tacos were good to me, but she didn't care for them.  I got a chimichanga, and it was covered with that cheese dip and some mysterious black drizzle (probably black bean puree).  The chimi was loaded with rice and beans...and very little chicken.  It was ok, but certainly not special.  My favorite things we had were the chips and salsa and the Quatro Leches cake.  Even the cake changed, though.  I think the cake used to be topped with meringue which was light and toasty, and is now topped with gloppy marshmallow cream which was cloyingly sweet.  I scraped it off and just ate the cake and it was moist and delicious.  I doubt we'll be back, as it is really expensive and you can get better quality food for far less money elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quatro Leches Cake.  Yummy except for the glob of Marshmallow cream on top.
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Steak tacos.  Shrimp was good!

75h90BDywalK1eoFfy2U8A.text: This is one of my favorite places in all of Charlotte and has been for years! Their food is consistently good and there is plenty of variety. The Tex-mex menu gives you everything from traditional Mexican to crazy updated versions. I am not typically a fajita person, but I love that they include zucchini and mushrooms. A few of my favorite dishes include the vegetarian mushroom, spinach, and goat cheese quesadilla, enchiladas tejanas (which is a beef stew you'll die for), and their salads are to die for.  As for drinks, my favorite is the Pina Margarita because it has no sour mix and the pineapple is so good. A fun fact is that they do not have the margarita flight on the menu, but you can always order it!  There are so many reasons this will always be a favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5 Cheese Queso Fundido
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Cast Iron Fajitas Dinner
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5 Cheese Queso Fundido

yO0EEkHco4ClIGkGZOGkWQ.text: Have a nice margarita selection with top shelf liquor. Quality of food was delicious and fresh.  My waiter was very friendly. Love the decor too.

KkUhwASGCyfZyeOLiEodbQ.text: I've never left Cantina 1511 without a very happy (and very full) belly. The Park Road location has a fun, upbeat atmosphere and plenty of seating for both small and large groups. We're typically seated right away, but expect a larger crowd at dinner on the weekends. If you're a fan of queso, get the Five Cheese Queso Fundido. It's admittedly pretty pricey, but worth EVERY penny. The hubby and I typically go for tacos and mix-and-match our orders. Some of our favs include the Thai Chili Glazed Shrimp (tons of flavor, small kick), the Baja Fish, and the 1511 Barbacoa. Neither of us have been huge fans of the Al Pastor - it's a little on the dry side. Also, keep in mind that you can switch up your sides if you're not in the mood for the traditional rice-and-beans. I got the street corn last time and it was bomb.com (but very messy - it's served on the cob).

n86xVy5ZSf6IVjSWbgU19g.text: While the place itself looks cool, the food was low quality, tasteless, and just can't understand how this passes as good Mexican food.  The ambiance/decor is pretty cool, and definitely a large space to have big groups or a private party.  As with other Yelpers, service here seems to be a pretty big issue.  While we were a relatively large group (8), it was pretty late for a Sunday brunch and there weren't many people in the restaurant, and we had to ask multiple times to just some of the simplest items.  Chips and salsa at the beginning is nice - most Mexican restaurants do it, but not all, so definitely am appreciative when they have that.  The green cilantro-based salsa was pretty good.  The veggie burrito was terrible.  The tortilla tasted weird, the veggies weren't fresh, the entire burrito tasted bland, and I feel like I could've whipped this up in my kitchen and it would've been a million times better than what was served to me.  The overall quality of the food was pretty resounding.  Overall, not a place I'd ever come back to the next time I'm in Charlotte.

33Px3sXg1LQ2DgGPNQgs0g.text: This place is expensive and terrible. For a family of four we paid $90 for sub par food. The drinks are pre mixed and taste like syrup. The tortillas are from a bag and the food, is not even close Mexican food. Being from a state that is use to AMAZING Mexican food this is the way over priced Mcdonalds of Mexican food. Please don't waste money.

OcWfe_tgo-EgZsQd0NMx1g.text: Favorite restaurant for Mexican food in Charlotte!  Great environment, great food, and great drinks!  On Tuesdays, the 1511 margarita is on special for $10!  Tip: Ask them to make it spicy!

PWkzEYYxNlmt9qUF_Tzymg.text: My family and I came to Cantina 1511 for my grandfather's 60th birthday. We were served complimentary chips and salsa which were absolutely delicious. The chips were thin and crispy while the salsa had a strong taste of cilantro (which I loved). The service however was not good at all. They never came and refilled our drinks, chips, or salsa without being asked, even when there was close to nobody in the restaurant. They just really didn't care or do the duties of good waiters. The food didn't impress either, I had a chicken quesadilla that had really weird tasting cheese. The enchiladas were gross looking and dry also. However, the tres leches cake was pretty good and very moist . Overall, I probably wont come back to Cantina 1511 because of personal preferences.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuatro Leches Cake the only good thing on the menu

VwHt9I-SdiwVh57nOcV9bw.text: This place has a great menu as well as portion sizes for the price I ordered the el vacquero quesadilla it's stuffed with smoked chicken jalapeno bacon it was delicious. Servers are informative and eager to suggest their favorite items. I highly recommend you try this place you won't regret it!

hotX72lpK7EkV-HBSRYedw.text: This place is in park road shopping center. You can get a good parking space since there are several available. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The drinks here need some work. In coming here I stuck to the shots or basics that you know. If you steer away from known territory you will get your feelings and pockets hurt for wasting money. The baja taco has flavor and the chicken taco needs seasoning. Whether you have the nacho app ( I recommend) or the tacos it's good portions. The decor is fun vibrant and lively. They don't have regular events but they could look into that to liven the place up. Happy eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shots.....it&#39;s what&#39;s for dessert
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak &amp; Chicken taco with both beans
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pick 2 taco combo chicken and Baja fish taco

4QzoVfeGV48o-g1ekBKu5A.text: My visit was after the lunch crowd, around 1:35 on a week day and we were sat immediately.    If you've never been, the decor and atmosphere can be classified as Americanized-Mexican.  Plenty of parking available. The ambiance is nice, decor is that of a mix of modern and Pier One Mexican decor.  There's modern American music playing, but it is very possible to have a conversation with people at your table.   Clientele is a good mix of stay at home mothers, old pals catching up for a drink and others there to have business lunches. Most are dressed from casual to business casual. Bar area wasn't busy, 3-4 patrons sitting at the bar. They offer daily drink specials but I didn't partake in this during my visit.   Our waiter was very attentive.  I was there for a quick meet up, to have some appetizers and not having a full fledged meal.  We ordered the Prima Guacamole (made at our table) and were very specific that we did not want anything spicy in our guacamole.  Waiter listened to us and made our guacamole perfectly.  Fresh tomatoes and lots of lime and a smidge of cilantro - just how I like it.  Chips were warm and had perfect salt seasoning - not too much, not too little.   We also ordered the Chicken empanadas off of the appetizer section.  This includes 4 triangle empanadas filled with  cheese, chicken and Pico de Gallo.  Perfect serving for two people. The plate was garnished well with a bed of lettuce and bits of tomatoes for the empanadas to lay in, empanadas were drizzled lightly with chipotle ranch and serve with side of guacamole and sour cream (not spicy). These empanadas were flavorful and served at perfect temperature!   We then shared a Cuatro Leches Cake to satisfy our sweet tooth.  Cuatro leches is a cake with four types of milk poured over it.   It is topped with a sugar-merengue, garnished with mint leaves.  It was DEVINE but very rich for just one person to have, in my opinion.  We shared this cuatro leches cake and between the both of us were unable to finish it.    We enjoyed our visit to Cantina but felt a rushed at the end, as our waiter brought our bill at the same time as our dessert.  Our total visit was less than a hour long, there were lots of open tables and no one waiting to be seated so I thought perhaps it was shift change.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

RqRfJgsaS_eZwT0gNVrpcA.text: Although I have always had a pleasant experience inside the restaurant of Cantina 1511, the food has never been amazing. I have been here at least 4 times and never found anything I loved. I have tried the Enchiladas Tejana, Enchilada Suiza, Carne Asada Quesadilla, and the Tortilla soup. Of those I would only ever order the Tortilla soup again. The only meal that I particularly didn't like was the carne asada quesadilla, it was extremely greasy and reminded me of a delivery pizza with steak - cheap cheese and grease. There wasn't anything wrong with the other meals, but they weren't great, mostly forgettable.

XW6WSU4zufzsG08pP1kVJg.text: Went here for lunch yesterday with my best friend and it was great. Cantina is one of my favorite restaurants to go to and I have yet to experience anything less than great service. The queso is an absolute must when ordering appetizers. The chips are freshly done and so tortillas with the queso is heavenly. I order the grilled mushroom and spinach quesadilla every time I go and, in my opinion, one of the best items on the menu. The drinks were delicious. I believe my friend and I both ordered the disco lemonade and I would definitely recommend it to anyone else.

ohkaZmzDyztn7zRV6bSikA.text: I've been to Cantina 1511 several times (both at the old East Blvd location and the new Park Rd location) and it never disappoints.   I'm a big fan of their tacos. I think they revamped they're menu since I was there last because I think there were way more taco options than before. I got the Angry Bird (Buffalo chicken) and the That Chili glazed shrimp tacos. Both were fantastic. I might have liked the shrimp one slightly more, but it's hard to pick one.   We went for lunch and out was pretty crowded. The service wasn't the fastest, but that's understandable considering how crowded it was.   I'll definitely be back again in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Angry Bird (Buffalo chicken) and Thai Chili glazed shrimp tacos

npaTdrRkCgJ7W7HP9BS6pA.text: Great food, big portions and quick service. I would recommend trying this place out. I had the chimichanga. Very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

n1xPc1M1U1UA9XqsdrW8gA.text: Came here for a group lunch on a Thursday.  We had 11 people and thought we would need a reservation. One was not needed! There was plenty of seating for us! The service was fast and helpful. We had someone who can't eat cheese and the waiter was very patient with helping the person order a burger to his liking.   I was mixed on if this would be a great place for food based on the reviews I read. I never went to this restaurant when it was on East blvd so I can not compare it to that.   For my first time I was pleased with the food! I ordered the 5 cheese queso and the spinach chicken enchiladas with the white sauce. The main dish was pretty good! The consistency was perfect and really good flavor. Now the queso.. I was slightly disappointed. It is difficult to disappoint me with cheese! I thought it was slightly bland. I also thought it tasted like cheese you would get at a fondue place and I'm not the biggest fan of that. I shared with others and they loved it! So it's all about preference. I was not paying for my meal and I would've been disappointed if I would've spent $9.75 of my own money on the queso. I put it in my rice though and it was good!   Other people at my table got burritos. I have NEVER seen a burrito as big as these!! They could last you 2-3 meals probably!   Overall, the atmosphere was great, you get free chips and delicious salsa, and the food good! I would probably go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5 cheese queso
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

i5Ge4V1XI0jgp1VK7t4RBQ.text: Love Cantina 1511!   We order delivery from here at least once a week.  This is not your typical Mexican fare which is loaded down with canned queso sauce.  Everything is fresh and delicious.  Their salmon al pastor never disappoints, always well seasoned and perfectly prepared -  never dry and over-cooked.  And the short rib and shrimp tacos  are also faves.  The manager, Vince, is awesome!  We had a special dietary request that he bent over backward to accommodate.  He truly understands what good customer service is all about.  We look forward to our "Cantina 1511 Night" every week!

8XodQHNZujCBHym04ern_Q.text: My girlfriend took me here on our way through Charlotte during a recent vacation. Enjoyed it well enough although I can't say it was memorable. The atmosphere was very lively but it was a bit pricey. I'd go again though.

upXOHuwmiWmPlKLYI_I2_g.text: This is a great place for something different. Its like they put it "An Evolution of Authentic Mexican Food." You can tell the owners and chefs take pride in their ingredients and cooking style. I also like the fact they support local farmers and make their own cheese and tortillas. Atmosphere is nice, can get a little packed on certain nights. The South Charlotte location is a little more "posh" and larger...but food is superb at both. Try the soft tacos...can't go wrong. Lots of choices for spirits.   Only reason I did not give them 5 stars is for one simple fact. I have been going here for a while now, and everytime I leave a comment about not having fried ice cream on the dessert menu. They keep telling me it is messy for the deep fryers.....come on think of something!

fUrcmSaQz9IjRvf5QHqfrw.text: This place is amazing!! A little different selection than the norm, but who wants normal?

gNxLppIByGoUrc-CT9fVVQ.text: We started with the queso which was awesome ( but then again when isnt cheese not awesome).  The food was a solid, it wasn't quite super authentic, but they had a little twist on it which I enjoyed.  It definitely feels like you are eating at a restaurant and so home made or fast food type place. I would probably return if a friend wanted Mexican and we were in the area.  I like how they make the gauc in front of you and endless chips are always good.  The only thing I didn't like was the decor was a little bit dreary and I agree with Faith about the mildew rag smell.  All in all, it was better than average

ia2g5MVrQDw32zQXbfEaaQ.text: Nice ambiance, great service.  Interesting drink menu with a good variety of flavors.  Guac made at the table and queso - good starters.  Ordered fajitas and chimi steak burrito--well presented and ok/good.  Not an inexpensive place, a little on the pricey side given flavors and quality.  Overall ok, but, prefer the flavors I get at La Unica in Huntersville better at around 50-60% of the price.

eD0NfLWb8WvSa6iGH6TYvw.text: I gave this place 4 start for their guacamole alone.  they make it to order at your table - Delicious!  The place is usually busy for lunch or dinner. The food is the americanized mexican but has some things  you would not expect.  Overall the food is prepared very well.  I have had the filet mignon tacos, grilled pork loin, tacos and burritos.    The place has a great bar and serves up some nice drinks.  It is a good place to meet friends and I have been with several large parties and the services has been spot on.

GNBWlmcbFuHO8k0WYYhXFw.text: What a great combination of Authentic Mexican and Tex Mex.  The wait staff is great, the food is excellent, the bar specials are good, and the overall experience is solid.  The parking is somewhat of a challenge, but you just work through it.

kx-WRVrmVPC53l_7sJqmsQ.text: Group fun at Cantina.... OH YEA... we got the fish bowl room!  Just be careful you don't run into the awkwardly placed glass partition.  Dinner was wicked good!  I had the veggie something or nother... Tasted fried, so I'm good!  Everyone at the table (8 or us) was pleased with everything that they ordered.  The waitress was very attentive even though our group seemed to have overwhelmed her a wee bit!  I do like this place a good bit, so if you're looking for a great lil mexican restaurant then definitely check it out.  I've never heard of anyone having a bad experience there!  Check out the Dragonberry cocktail!  It's spectacular!    Make reservations, they book up quick!

nvsx_V9Q6UYbssNDICCjCw.text: Authentic Mexican food is tough to find in Charlotte but this place does a solid job of bridging that need. Reservations were easy enough. This places uses opentable. The ambiance is very family oriented; don't be surpised to see children and families dining there for dinner. I got the enchildas and they came with rice and beans. Although I got only two, the meal was large enough that it filled me up. Food was flavorful and fresh.

SYRK-cSVBmqtmf3k9XKXBQ.text: Cantina 1511 is a very nice Tex-Mex restaurant. The service was great. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. The ambiance screams modern mexico with an American twist. From the outside walking in, Good luck finding parking, I had to park on the street because parking is limited. Luckily the neighborhood is a pretty good one so I had no problem with that. I had the "Enchiladas de Pollo" which was pretty damn good to me (it was plated nicely/ could of been better but I'm not picky about that). Yes, it was on the cheesy side but I like cheese. The chicken was a little dry, that's were all that cheese came into play. I think they would of had a 5-star dish on their hands if they brined the chicken first and then grilled it. Overall I was happy with my dish. The dinner party I was with had the some of the dishes pictured, 1. Chimichanga (looked F'n Delicious) 2. Ancho Chicken Quesadillas (the chicken chunks were actually pretty big). No one complained about their food but I can say the prices were moderately higher than your average Mexican restaurant, that would be a major downfall for me to go back to Cantina on a regular basis. If your ever in Charlotte of course I would inform you to check out this place for any special occasion. Just make sure your ready to spend a little more on Mexican food.

Hj8_u6EukWSt7T5PKe4DZA.text: This used to be my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte. When I heard it had new owners, I got a little nervous. (and for good reason) The menu seems to be all mixed up. Very hard to read. A lot of the previous items, my favorites, are no longer there. And the food did not seem fresh at all. For a more Authentic Mexican experience (with a rougher exterior) I would suggest Azteca off of South Blvd.

z7Vmb0yOPyY0SUH5Hq2Kqg.text: I had a rough time at Cantina 1511 which is shocking because I've always had a great meal there in the past. I went with a friend and we ordered out lunches. When they were brought out she found something in her taco. It wasn't a hair but it looked like a bristle from a brush. Then I got a bone in my taco. The GM was fantastic and came right over and took care of our meal for us after apologizing a million times. Once would have been enough but he really wanted us to be happy. That is great customer service. I've eaten here a million times before and this is the only time I've ever had a problem but it was quickly corrected by them. They took our plates back and replaced our meals then kindly picked up our check. I will definitely go back again.

S-Y6ZHnrNhjF37lxsrFAng.text: I've actually been to the one on Rea Road, which doesn't seem to be listed on Yelp.  I remember this restaurant because the food was amazing! The server was extremely helpful with what he recommended, because I ordered exactly both recommendations for the appetizer and entree. They were both great. The appetizer was the Queso Fundido I think, which looked like a small pizza. Very cheesy. The entree was Barbacoa del Puerco, which was awesome. It came with tortillas where I could wrap shredded pork with other toppings such as beans, guacamole, rice, pico de gallo, cheeses, and lettuce.  YUM YUM YUM. Service was also excellent.

traFkLWYUCvYU89kv6EJ_Q.text: I had dinner at Cantina last weekend. There was a good crowd of people there. We were seated immediately and ordered drinks. The food was awesome! We started off with some Cantina Nachos. For my entree on this visit, I ordered the Salmon al Pastor. Excellente!  I am a service person as well. My waitress was attentive, helpful and friendly. I have been here multiple times and always have the best experience. If you are looking good Mexican food in a great atmosphere, Cantina 1511 is the place.

1tGdO7TgsQIhL3GbThlCTA.text: Mmmm, I love this place, it doesn't get any better for Mexican food than this. I haven't been in a couple months but use to frequent this place for lunch when I went to school in the area. I would usually get their small Mexican chopped salad and it was huge, more than enough for one person. It also had a good variety of veggies on it, chick peas, jicama, avocado, peppers, onion and tomatoes. I'd usually add shrimp or chicken to it for my protein as well. I've also had their tacos with shrimp which are very tasty. They bring fresh chips and salsa to your table when you arrive and if you order the guacamole they'll prepare it tableside for you. Also be sure to try one of their Mojitos.;-)

P_pqM2IQJXwhrXp2Je4U1Q.text: This is by far the best Mexican restaurant I have ever eaten at.  I usually don't even care for Mexican food, but I love this place. My wife is going to have a hard time convincing me to eat at any other Mexican restaurant.

18zqdD4uI3C9Mk6UpW6sgw.text: Great place.  Wonderful service.  I have tried just about everything on the menu and have never been disappointed.  Some favorites are the Barbacoa, Steak Chimchanga, and the Guac!  Parking for lunch can be tough.  Don't park out back or you will either get booted or towed.  At night they do have valet parking.  Looking for a fun place to go, that won't let you down this is it.

b2Xj2AhUgOBgvWkYnZIN0Q.text: Great guacamole here. We visited during a slow time and got to enjoy a very chilled out atmosphere. The food and drinks were delicious and obviously very fresh. The service was solid too! I will return.

k6O4XWXkOG1q_bdIIkYq0g.text: Great food and great prices. Authentic Mexican food and Tex Mex. This is not a run of the mill mexican joint. The soup is a meal itself. Margaritas are smooth and yum. They have an excellent happy hour menu too.

Fa0gb0gmpv4rjQM9D9gf7g.text: I visited Cantina 1511 for a Saturday lunch and ordered the enchiladas de Dennis.  Although the flavor was warm and inviting it did not wow the palate.  The food seems to be very 'visitor friendly'.  It is as one would expect for TexMex, not a traditional enchilada but also not bold or daring in its ingredient selection or spices.    Service was adequate as it was not very busy around 1 PM on a Saturday. We were seated in the front of the restaurant closest to the road.  I'm not sure if the guys at the table next to us just had large lungs with voices that carried or if the room could have used some sound barriers because I could hear their conversation better than our own!

lmepZAbFaI553c23E15nAQ.text: I want to start off my review by saying we really like the food here.  The chicken tortilla soup and fajitas are great.  Now to the problem.  We were given a $50 gift certificate to Cantina 1511 for xmas and went there Sunday 1-11-15 to use it.  After ordering a few drinks and fajitas our bill was $33.  We were told by the manager that the remaining balance of $17 was not redeemable and we would lose it.  Why couldn't they just give us another gift certificate for the balance???  The manager told us "she just works here and that's the way it is".  I'm not sure why they can't join the rest of the world and use gift cards, but it left a bad taste in our mouths and we may not return.

4R1E_CZLX6ENRov8hrFCHg.text: Cantina is always my go to for girls night out or for b'day celebrations.  It's great for crowds,  the food is pretty much always good and so is the service.  It's a bit on the pricier side for Mexican/ Tex-Mex but I think the atomosphere makes it worth the extra money.  Plus, you can split all their meals.  It is a two dollar split charge-  but they give each person a full serving of the sides-- so it really evens it out-  its a TON of food.

vIlXgqDbhYsBjYoldVhThw.text: Amazing food. Spectacular service. Let me just tell you that this experience was so great that I signed up to Yelp just to write this review. Heather was our server and it was truly delightful; Carrie the manager also stopped by and was quite engaging-recommending fun things to do as we came in from out of town.  You must eat here!

pnP5l6AceV0wVGNikact1w.text: I've been here many times over the past 5 years and have never had a bad meal. Service is always spot on. Great queso

uI9ipKYpQ4-bvmdUHwVV3w.text: Food was ok, but with poor service and unfriendly staff it wasn't worth it. They messed up the number of people on our  reservation as well.

SBlbsSRPwoq8LUk-FYynVg.text: I don't like Mexican food all that much, but I've been here twice, both times I cleaned my plate, and I plan on going back.    I have had a taco and a burrito, and both were very good--fresh, well-seasoned, and nice presentation.    The ambiance is good, and it always seems to be busy (a good sign for a restaurant).

mIZiUQ6Ek70CW2t6JAF-pw.text: Good food. Good drinks. A little pricy. Chips and salsa were great.

fopsSewtVK4r4aLuTdceAg.text: We headed over to Dilworth to eat at Lebowski's the day after Christmas only to have our hopes dashed when it was closed.  Luckily, Cantina 1511 was open across the street.  And as a Mexican food snob, I can safely say that Cantina has the best salsa I've had since I left San Diego.  Spicy without being too spicy, flavorful, and good consistency to adhere itself to the chip.  I now regret not trying their guac.  Decent food overall.  But man, that salsa!  Start bottling it.

bi1SDxwv4JLcVV40mtl8-A.text: New location is great, especially the patio area up front. Much nicer all around vs. the previous location on East Blvd. Always good, consistent quality food every time I've been there.

qUJJ-8fvM3l0XQwsdMjcFQ.text: It's not often my family finds a place that everyone loves. Usually, someone won't eat.... Well, not this time.. Everything was awesome food, service and they easy to find.

UNTGZ_kSiZHzt3c__1lUaw.text: Sorry kids, after hearing many people raving about this place, my girlfriend and i finally decided that we needed our Mexican fix. We love Mexican food, but apparently we have become too accustomed to the run of the mill 'authentic' Mexican food. Not the Chipotle or Moes, but the sit-down  restaurant with menus with wet burritos and a listing of 30+ numbered dishes.  i had a traditional Mexican dish, while she had  a Tex Mex burrito. Her burrito was huge, but she only eat a few bites, It just wasn't good. i had the traditional enchiladas and they were slightly more edible, however, we wouldn't go back for either dish. The beans were like a bad bean soup, the rice didn't have much taste (other than the peas mixed in),   The atmosphere was great and the server was very attentive and i really wanted to like the place, but i can't say i'll be back.

FbnZOxN66S9KQ62eXgJbMg.text: I've tried different Mexican restaurants in the area and no-one has better food or chips and salsa than cantina. Never had anything I didn't like. Even their salads are fantastic. If anything, it just keeps getting better.

o27pkI6_ptLZQTbNHv5J8g.text: We've been to the Ballantyne version of this restaurant before, but this was our first time at the Dilworth location. I think the menu is similar or nearly identical, but this time we had some items we'd never had before and it was all absolutely fabulous. I had not been expecting it. The appetizer we ordered was something about Pig Wings and it was out of this world. The grilled and glazed pork pieces were exceedingly tender, flavorful and rich. The richness was gorgeously balanced by the acidity of the slaw and pickled red onions. Then I had their fish of the day (mahi mahi) cooked in a unique Spanish style casserole with garlic, pine nuts artichokes and Spanish sweet potato. Incredible. My husband loved his roasted carnitas (pork).  Best food in a LONG time, for a great price

h1EE-XKA_rgfnON3EEWbPw.text: I went to Cantina 1511 after noticing Eric K's recent review of this place on Yelp.  I can't believe I've overlooked this place until now. I'm a fairly enthusiastic consumer of Mexican food, and Cantina 1511 is the best I've had in Charlotte. I won't waste too much space reiterating all the great things that have already been said about this place, but I'd like to touch on the highlights.  The atmosphere is very nice--a little more upscale than your standard Mexican place. The service was friendly and professional--I was with a picky diner and they had no problems customizing her order. The food was obviously great, and I felt the prices were pretty good--dinner for two was about thirty bucks (without alcohol).   I had the Barbacoa, and everything about it was excellent. Presentation was great, temperature was perfect, and taste was incredible. My guest had the enchiladas and was similarly satisfied.  Highly recommended all around.

KYjYfM9dxSBpJW1njIalmQ.text: Rea Rad  location has insufficient parking forcing valet parking. Enchiladas Rojas are barely edible. Food over priced. Waiters push margaritas as if they were made with gold. This restaurant is all marketing/ brand  hype with forgettable food. Why is there not a "zero star" rating?

R5NkdctrghSNgFZisAXikg.text: This has become my favorite Mexican restaurant. I feel like they understand what Mexican food is from all the different parts of Mexico. It's not just Tex-Mex but it has mixes of Baja flavors as well.  The staff was awesome and it was an enjoyable evening!! Can't wait to go there once again.  UPDATE: 1/23/2010 - My Partner and I went there last night for our 10 year anniversary. The staff was just as warm and as engaging as ever.
